# Survival Analysis {#SurvivalAnalysis}

## Survival function {#sec-SurvivalFunction}

$$
\begin{aligned}
S(t) &= \operatorname{P}(T > t) \\&= 1 - F(t)
\end{aligned}
$$

**Properties**

-   Monotonically decreasing, i.e. $S(t_2) \leq S(t_1)$ for all $t_1 \geq t_2$.

## Hazard function {#sec-HazardFunction}

The hazard function $h$ describes the instantaneous risk of an event at a time $t$. $$\begin{aligned}
h(t) &= \lambda(t) \\&= \lim_{\Delta t \to 0}\frac{\operatorname{P}\left(t \leq T < t + \Delta t \mid T \geq t\right)}{\Delta t}
\end{aligned}$$

### Cumulative hazard function

$$
H(t) = \int_0^t h(u)\,\textrm{d}u
$$

### Hazard ratio (HR) {#HazardRatio}

-   $\textrm{HR} < 1$: increased survival probability, compared to reference
-   $\textrm{HR} = 1$: No difference in survival probability, compared to reference
-   $\textrm{HR} > 1$: decreased survival probability, compared to reference

## Cumulative incidence function (CIF) {#sec-CIF}

$$\begin{aligned}
F(t) &= \operatorname{P}(T \leq t) \\&= \int_0^t h(u) \cdot S(u) \,\textrm{d}u
\end{aligned}$$
